actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to increase from 22 to 23 the age until which child's insurance benefits may be paid on the basis of full-time student status, and the age before which a child must have become disabled in order to qualify for such benefits on the basis of disability.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Increases from 22 to 23 the age until which a child's insurance benefits under the Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance provisions of the Social Security Act may be paid on the basis of full-time student status, and the age before which a child must have become disabled in order to qualify for such benefits on the basis of disability.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to increase from 22 to 23 the age until which child's insurance benefits may be paid on the basis of full-time student status, and the age before which a child must have become disabled in order to qualify for such benefits on the basis of disability.
